1.3 - Excavation to be set out according to survey marks and appropriate benchmark RLs

1.1 - Ensure that the latest revision of the relevant drawing is being used.
1.2 - Confirm existing and proposed drainage locations
HOLD - Continue only if the above is signed off.
2.2 - All stormwater pipes and manholes shall be placed in accordance with surveyor's layout and locations given in design drawings.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS - M&P drainage long section sheet, M&P manhole sheet

2.3 - Stormwater trench should be excavated to design levels given in drawings. Tolerances given are -0mm, +50mm for line and -50mm, +0mm for level. Trench to be benched or battered when depth exceed 1.2m. Trench width to be dependant on pipe diameter and trench depth.
SPEC REFERENCE / SPECIAL CONDITIONS - Drawing C-C401 and C-C402
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS - M&P drainage long section sheet, M&P manhole sheet
2.4 - IF rock is encountered levels and photos are to be taken. Geotech must inspect rock prior to any break out. Levels and photos must be taken post-breakout.
HOLD - Continue only if the above is signed off.
2.5 - Breakout to commence once Client issue site instruction
HOLD - Continue only if the above is signed off.
3.1 - All manholes shall be installed with accordance to locations shown on civil drawings. Any variations to be approved by Client prior to installation.
SPEC REFERENCE / SPECIAL CONDITIONS - Drawing C-C401 and C-C402
3.2 - Stormwater mains and downpipes to be laid out in accordance with design drawings. Any Variations to be approved by Client before installation.
SPEC REFERENCE / SPECIAL CONDITIONS - Drawing C-C401 and C-C402

3.3 - Pipes shall be laid true to alignment and with inverts true to grade. All manhole connections shall be in accordance with civil engineering specifications and Auckland Council standard drawings.
SPEC REFERENCE / SPECIAL CONDITIONS - SWCoP DWG No. SW05
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS - M&P Long Section Sheet, M&P Manhole Check Sheets
HOLD - Continue only if the above is signed off.
3.5 - M&P Drainage long section and Manhole sheets to be completed.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS - M&P drainage long section sheet, M&P manhole sheet
3.6 - Pipes shall be bedded on 100mm minimum depth of approved fine granular material.
SPEC REFERENCE / SPECIAL CONDITIONS - AS/NZS 2566 Part 2: 2002
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS - M&P Long Section Sheet, M&P Manhole Check Sheets

3.7 - Lower surface to 1/4 of the pipe diameter shall be on the compacted material. From this point up to 300mm above the crown of the pipe, selected filling material (with 20mm maximum partial size) shall be rammed & tamped in layers of no more than 150mm depth.
SPEC REFERENCE / SPECIAL CONDITIONS - AS/NZS 2566 Part 2: 2002
3.8 - All pipework to be inspected by clients engineer and Council inspector and signed off before trench can be backfilled
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS - Council & Engineer Approval Report
HOLD - Continue only if the above is signed off.
3.9 - If instructed by Client - Any pipe with less than 600mm cover must be concrete capped
3.10 - Trench to be backfilled with approved granular material and compacted sufficiently
SPEC REFERENCE / SPECIAL CONDITIONS - AS/NZS 2566 Part 2: 2002
WW4.0 - Handover to client with PS3
4.2 - Completed pipe sections to be CCTV'd
4.3 - As build all pipe invert levels in manholes and CP and lid levels
SPEC REFERENCE / SPECIAL CONDITIONS - PS3 Drainage

2.2 - All wastewater pipes and manholes shall be placed in accordance with surveyor's layout and locations given in design drawings.
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS - M&P drainage long section sheet, M&P manhole sheet

2.3 - Wastewater trench should be excavated to design levels given in drawings. Tolerances given are -0mm, +50mm for line and -50mm, +0mm for level. Trench to be benched or battered when depth exceed 1.2m. Trench width to be dependant on pipe diameter and trench depth. Use trench shield if battered cannot be achieve.
SPEC REFERENCE / SPECIAL CONDITIONS - Drawing C-C401 and C-C402
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS - M&P drainage long section sheet, M&P manhole sheet
2.4 - IF rock is encountered levels and photos are to be taken. Geotech must inspect rock prior to any break out. Levels and photos must be taken post-breakout.

3.6 - Lower surface to 1/4 of the pipe diameter shall be on the compacted material. From this point up to 300mm above the crown of the pipe, selected filling material (with 20mm maximum partial size) shall be rammed & tamped in layers of no more than 150mm depth.
